title: FACT CHECK: Anil Ambani withdrew defamation suit only against Priyanka Chaturvedi? - Times of India
subtitle: News News: Tweets doing rounds on Twitter claim that Anil Ambani's Reliance Group has withdrawn Rs 5,000 crore civil defamation suit only against former Congress
author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
vclaim: Tweets doing rounds on Twitter claim that Anil Ambani 's Reliance Group has withdrawn Rs 5,000 crore civil defamation suit only against former Congress spokesperson Priyanka Chaturvedi , who recently joined the Shiv Sena One Twitter user claimed that “fake news was being spread that defamation suit against Congress has been withdrawn when in reality Reliance withdrew case only against Chaturvedi, who once was with Congress”. To make this claim, he posted an image of a letter purportedly issued by Rasesh Parikh, Reliance Group’s lawyer, to Chaturvedi.The same letter, with the same claim, was tweeted by many others.Apart from Priyanka Chaturvedi, Ambani’s Reliance Group has withdrawn defamation suits filed against many Congress leaders and National Herald newspaper.Times of India had yesterday reported about Ambani withdrawing defamation cases against Congress leaders.The story reads “Anil Ambani's Reliance Group has decided to withdraw the Rs 5,000-crore civil defamation suits filed in an Ahmedabad court against Congress leaders and National Herald newspaper over their statements and an article on the controversial Rafale fighter jet deal.”Reliance Defence, Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Aerostructure-- part of the Anil Ambani-owned Reliance Group-- had earlier filed civil defamation suits against Congress leaders including Sunil Jakhar, Randeep Singh Surjewala, Oommen Chandy, Ashok Chavan, Abhishek Manu Singhvi, Sanjay Nirupam and Shaktisinh Gohil, and some journalists and news organisations like the National Herald.The defamation suits were also filed against the National Herald's editor Zafar Agha, and Vishwadeepak, the author of a news article published in the paper.The formal process to withdraw the suits will be taken up in the Supreme Court when it resumes after the summer vacation, the TOI report mentioned.Times Fact Check got in touch with Chaturvedi, who confirmed that the defamation suit against her has been withdrawn. She said she has received a correspondence mail from Reliance Group regarding the same.Another Times of India report quoted advocate Pankaj Champaneri, who represents many Congress leaders, the publication house Associated Journals, and its publication, National Herald. He confirmed withdrawal of cases against Congress leaders.Reliance’s lawyer informed them that the cases against National Herald, Gujarat Congress leader Shaktisinh Gohil, ex-Kerala CM Oomen Chandy, ex-Maharshtra CM Ashok Chavan, Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala , senior Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi and ex-Congress spokesperson Priyanka Chaturvedi (who left Congress for Shiv Sena) would be withdrawn, the report mentions.Times Fact Check has found claims of Anil Ambani withdrawing defamation suit only against Priyanka Chaturvedi (since she joined Shiv Sena) and not other Congress leaders, to be false.
